div.head: CHAP. CXIII.
1 An exhortation to praise God for his excellencie, 6 for his Mercy.
div.ab: Praise yee the Lord. Praise, O yee seruants of the Lord: praise the name of the Lord. Heb. Halleluiah.
Blessed be the name of the Lord: from this time forth and for euermore. Dan.2. 20.
From the rising of the sunne vnto the going downe of the same: the Lords name is to be praised. Mal.1.11.
The Lord is high aboue all nations: and his glory aboue the heauens.
Who is like vnto the Lord our God: who dwelleth on high: Heb. exalteth himselfe to dwell.
Who humbleth himselfe to behold the things that are in heauen, and in the earth?
He raiseth vp the poore out of the dust: and lifteth the needie out of the dung-hill: 1.Sam. 2.8. psal. 107.41.
That he may set him with princes: euen with the princes of his people.
He maketh the barren woman to keepe house; to be a ioyfull mother of children: Praise yee the Lord. Heb. to dwell in an house.
